questions.text: Who played Xena in 'Xena: Warrior Princess'?
questions.explanation: Lucy Lawless portrayed Xena throughout the series run from 1995-2001.

questions.text: What was the name of Xena's sidekick and best friend?
questions.explanation: Gabrielle, played by Renee O'Connor, was Xena's loyal companion and the heart of the series.

questions.text: What was Xena's signature battle cry?
questions.explanation: Xena's distinctive 'Yi-yi-yi-yi-yi!' battle cry became one of the show's most iconic elements.

questions.text: What year did Xena first appear on Hercules?
questions.explanation: Xena first appeared in three episodes of Hercules: The Legendary Journeys in 1995 before getting her own series.

questions.text: What was Xena's signature weapon?
questions.explanation: Xena's chakram, a circular throwing weapon, was her most iconic tool that she could ricochet off multiple targets.

questions.text: Who was Xena's arch-nemesis?
questions.explanation: Xena had multiple major antagonists including Callisto, Caesar, and Ares, each representing different threats.

questions.text: What weapon did Gabrielle use?
questions.explanation: Gabrielle initially used a staff, though she later also learned to use sais.

questions.text: How many seasons did Xena run?
questions.explanation: Xena: Warrior Princess ran for six seasons from 1995 to 2001.

questions.text: Who played the psychotic Callisto?
questions.explanation: Hudson Leick brilliantly portrayed the vengeful and unhinged Callisto.

questions.text: What was Gabrielle's initial profession?
questions.explanation: Gabrielle was originally a young bard from Potidaea who chronicled Xena's adventures.

questions.text: Who was the God of War who constantly pursued Xena?
questions.explanation: Ares, the God of War played by Kevin Smith, was obsessed with Xena and wanted her as his Warrior Queen.

questions.text: What was the name of the Amazon tribe Gabrielle joined?
questions.explanation: Gabrielle became an Amazon Princess and later Queen of the Greek Amazons.

questions.text: What was the name of Xena's horse?
questions.explanation: Argo was Xena's loyal palomino warhorse throughout most of the series.

questions.text: Who was Xena's son?
questions.explanation: Solan (sometimes spelled Solon) was Xena's son with the warlord Borias, raised by centaurs.

questions.text: What was special about Xena's chakram?
questions.explanation: Xena's chakram could split into two pieces, always returned when thrown, and could cut through most materials.

questions.text: Who was Gabrielle's daughter?
questions.explanation: Hope was Gabrielle's daughter, conceived when Gabrielle was impregnated by the demon Dahak.

questions.text: What historical figure was a recurring antagonist?
questions.explanation: Julius Caesar, played by Karl Urban, was a major recurring villain who had a complex history with Xena.

questions.text: What was the name of Xena's daughter?
questions.explanation: Xena's daughter was named Eve, but she was known as Livia when she was a Roman warrior.

questions.text: Where was Xena primarily filmed?
questions.explanation: Like Hercules, Xena was filmed entirely in New Zealand, which doubled for ancient Greece.

questions.text: What was Xena's relationship with Hercules?
questions.explanation: After initially being a villain on Hercules, Xena reformed and became friends and allies with Hercules.

questions.text: What special ability did Xena have?

options.A: The Pinch that cut off blood flow

questions.explanation: Xena could use a nerve pinch that cut off blood flow to the brain, giving victims 30 seconds to live unless released.

questions.text: Who was Xena's mentor in her dark past?
questions.explanation: Alti, a shamaness, taught Xena dark arts and was a recurring villain from Xena's past.

questions.text: What was the name of the warlord Xena loved?
questions.explanation: Xena had romantic relationships with Marcus, Borias (father of her son), and Ulysses over the series.

questions.text: What was Gabrielle's Amazon title?
questions.explanation: Gabrielle inherited the title of Amazon Princess and later became Amazon Queen.

questions.text: How did Xena typically defeat enemies?
questions.explanation: Xena relied on exceptional combat skills, acrobatics, and clever strategies rather than supernatural powers.

questions.text: What was the 'Xena Scroll'?

options.B: Gabrielle's written account of their adventures

questions.explanation: The Xena Scrolls were Gabrielle's written chronicles of their adventures, referenced in modern-day episodes.

questions.text: Who composed the iconic Xena theme music?
questions.explanation: Joseph LoDuca composed the memorable Xena theme and much of the series' music.

questions.text: What religion did Gabrielle adopt later in the series?
questions.explanation: Gabrielle followed Eli's Way of Love, a pacifist philosophy similar to early Christianity.

questions.text: How did the series finale end?
questions.explanation: In the controversial finale, Xena died in Japan and chose to remain dead to save souls, appearing only as a spirit.

questions.text: What was Callisto's motivation for revenge?
questions.explanation: Callisto's family died when Xena's army burned her village of Cirra when she was a child.

questions.text: What modern-day device appeared in fantasy episodes?
questions.explanation: The show had fun 'present day' episodes where descendants found the Xena Scrolls, featuring modern technology.

questions.text: Who was Joxer?
questions.explanation: Joxer the Mighty was a comic relief character, a well-meaning but inept warrior who loved Gabrielle.

questions.text: What was unique about the musical episodes?
questions.explanation: Musical episodes like 'The Bitter Suite' featured original songs sung by the cast and furthered major storylines.

questions.text: What was the relationship between Xena and Gabrielle?
questions.explanation: Their relationship encompassed all these dynamics and was the emotional core of the series.

questions.text: Who played Autolycus in Xena crossover episodes?
questions.explanation: Bruce Campbell reprised his Hercules role as Autolycus, the King of Thieves, in Xena episodes.

questions.text: What was Xena's past before redemption?
questions.explanation: Xena was a brutal warlord known as 'Destroyer of Nations' before choosing the path of redemption.

questions.text: Which god gave Xena her 'pinch' technique?

options.B: No god, she learned it from a Chinese warrior

questions.explanation: Xena learned the nerve pinch technique from Lao Ma, a Chinese warrior and philosopher.

questions.text: What happened when Xena and Gabrielle went to India?
questions.explanation: In a major arc, Xena and Gabrielle were crucified in the Roman Empire and later reborn, jumping 25 years forward.

questions.text: Who was Aphrodite in the series?
questions.explanation: Aphrodite, goddess of love, was portrayed as a bubbly, helpful character who often aided the heroes.

questions.text: What was the show's stance on historical accuracy?
questions.explanation: The show freely mixed different time periods and mythologies, prioritizing storytelling over historical accuracy.

questions.text: What was Xena's home village?
questions.explanation: Xena was from Amphipolis, where her mother Cyrene ran a tavern.

questions.text: What significant event happened to Gabrielle's hair?
questions.explanation: Gabrielle cut her long hair short in Season 3, marking a significant character evolution.

questions.text: Who was Eli?
questions.explanation: Eli was a peaceful prophet whose Way of Love influenced Gabrielle and mirrored early Christianity.

questions.text: What was the relationship between Ares and Xena?
questions.explanation: Ares and Xena had a complex relationship involving attraction, manipulation, and occasional partnership.

questions.text: How many times was Lucy Lawless pregnant during filming?
questions.explanation: Lucy Lawless was pregnant twice during the show, which was written into the storyline both times.
